The cable company servicing my area offers a recording service, 60 hours capacity, for $9/mo. Online controls, very easy to use, includes HDTV offerings. While I'm not much of a TV watcher, my wife is an avid fan. We never saved videos or save DVD recordings for repeated viewing, and I've found this to be very cost effective when compared to replacing quality DVD recorders/players in three rooms as technology makes its advances.

I purchased and installed a TV card that lets me record video as digital file. I don't have to pay the monthly fee and I can program it to record while I am away. If I want to keep the video, I can burn it onto a DVD or just delete the file when I am done.

title: 4Forums.com Political Debates and Polls -  Cable TV recording capability
